subdisciplines.name: Expressivism
subdisciplines.description: The view that moral claims express either an emotion or a non-cognitive attitude.

subdisciplines.name: Error Theory
subdisciplines.description: The view that all moral claims are false or mistaken.

subdisciplines.name: Moral Realism
subdisciplines.description: The view that moral claims can be true or false and that some moral claims are in fact true.

subdisciplines.name: Moral Relativism
subdisciplines.description: The view that moral claims are true or false only relative to a given individual or culture.

subdisciplines.name: Moral Cognitivism
subdisciplines.description: The view that moral claims are cognitive and capable of being true or false.
